```{=html}
<div class="person-card" style="margin-bottom: 2rem; padding: 1.5rem; border: 1px solid #eee; border-radius: 8px; background: #fafafa;"><div style="display: flex; gap: 1.5rem; align-items: flex-start;"><img alt="Bruce Hauman" src="images/bruce-hauman.jpg" style="width: 120px; height: 120px; border-radius: 50%; object-fit: cover; flex-shrink: 0;" /><div style="flex: 1;"><h3 style="margin: 0 0 0.5rem 0; color: #333;">Bruce Hauman</h3><p style="margin: 0 0 1rem 0; font-weight: bold; color: #666; font-size: 0.9rem;">Macroexpand-Deep Speaker</p><p style="margin: 0; line-height: 1.6;">Bruce Hauman is a prolific toolmaker and long-time contributor to the Clojure community, perhaps best known as the creator of Figwheel‚Äîthe build tool that introduced live code reloading and made real-time browser development a reality for ClojureScript developers. Bruce‚Äôs legendary 2014 ‚ÄúFlappy Bird‚Äù demo not only turned heads, but set a new standard for interactive coding, enabling developers to see their changes instantly and stay in the creative flow.
Bruce also built Devcards, a library for interactive documentation that brings a visual REPL experience to ClojureScript, and Rebel Readline, the feature-rich REPL for Clojure and ClojureScript, complete with syntax highlighting, code completion, and inline documentation.
Bruce‚Äôs latest project, Clojure MCP, tackles the next frontier: enabling AI assistants to work Clojure projects by connecting directly to live REPLs, providing real-time feedback and validation to improve the quality of AI-generated Clojure code.
Beyond his tool building chops, Bruce is guided by a profound respect for users and a conviction that developer tooling should be radically better‚Äîsimple, powerful, and joyful to use. He‚Äôs also a fan of the outdoors: an avid canoe tripper, Appalachian Trail thru-hiker, and, currently, the hands-on renovator of a former church-turned-home in Saskatchewan.</p><div style="margin-top: 1rem;"><p style="margin: 0 0 0.5rem 0; font-weight: bold; color: #555; font-size: 0.9rem;">Sessions:</p><ul style="margin: 0; padding-left: 1.5rem;"><li style="margin-bottom: 0.25rem;"><a href="sessions.html#panel-ai-assistants" style="color: #0066cc; text-decoration: none;">Panel: AI assistants</a></li></ul></div></div></div></div>
```
